intro: Thladiantha digitata, commonly known as the five-finger vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its tendrils that aid in climbing. The plant produces small, yellow flowers followed by green, fleshy fruits that turn orange when mature. Its leaves are palmately lobed, giving it the common name "five-finger," and it is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
